verses.text: The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.

similars.text: Yea, the fir trees rejoice at thee, and also the cedars of Lebanon, saying: Since thou art laid down no feller is come up against us.
But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.
And they said unto me: What meaneth the rod of iron which our father saw, that led to the tree?
The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones; the sycamores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.

And it came to pass that the Spirit said unto me: Look! And I looked and beheld a tree; and it was like unto the tree which my father had seen; and the beauty thereof was far beyond, yea, exceeding of all beauty; and the whiteness thereof did exceed the whiteness of the driven snow.

And the people who were in the land northward did dwell in tents, and in houses of cement, and they did suffer whatsoever tree should spring up upon the face of the land that it should grow up, that in time they might have timber to build their houses, yea, their cities, and their temples, and their synagogues, and their sanctuaries, and all manner of their buildings.
And he caused that upon those works of timbers there should be a frame of pickets built upon the timbers round about; and they were strong and high.
And I beheld a rod of iron, and it extended along the bank of the river, and led to the tree by which I stood.
And let thy house be filled, as with a rushing mighty wind, with thy glory.
Let the hearts of your brethren rejoice, and let the hearts of all my people rejoice, who have, with their might, built this house to my name.
